moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 h6 4. Nc3 Nf6: After 5 moves white developed 5 pieces. That's good. After 5 moves has developed 2 pieces. That's bad.
moves.6. d4 b5: For his move 6th move black moves his 4th pawn which white correctly punishes.
moves.7. Bxf7+ Kxf7 8. Nxe5+ Nxe5 9. dxe5 Ne8: & the bishop is returned with interest.
moves.11... c6 12. Qa7 c5 13. Qa8: I prefer 13.  Be3. It develops a piece, connects the rooks, & attacks the c5 pawn.
moves.13... d6 14. exd6 Nxd6 15. Qd5 Be7 16. f: 16. Bf4 developing a piece, attacking the knight & connecting the rooks.
moves.16... Kh7 17. b3 b4 18. Ne2 Bf6 19. e5 R: When ahead swap pieces not pawns. They should be queened.
moves.23... Qxd3 24. cxd3 Nc5 25. d4 Nd3 26. f: 28. Rfd1 & let the Ra have the open c file. Also black's last move was to play b5. Get the Rf off the bishop's path.
moves.28... Bb5 29. Rf3 a5 30. Ne4 Bc6 31. Rh3: This is a faulty bishop sac. Compare with 7. Bxf7
Or 42. Bf2  Kh3 43. Rb5b4 any 44. Rg2g3#
moves.42... Rh8 43. d5: When ahead trade pieces. 43. Rh6  Rxh6 44. Bxh6 & black resigns because he can't cross the g file to stop the pawns.
moves.43... Rh5: Black takes the bait & is mated.
